meanings.definition: To give power or authority to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The king impowers his knights to protect the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The new law impowers the police to enforce stricter rules.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand impowers the wizard to cast powerful spells.
meanings.sent4: Education impowers individuals to achieve their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape impowers him to fly through the sky.

meanings.definition: To enable or authorize someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The key impowers access to the secret room.
meanings.sent2: Training impowers employees to handle difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: The special badge impowers entry into the exclusive club.
meanings.sent4: Confidence impowers students to speak up in class.
meanings.sent5: Teamwork impowers the group to accomplish great things.
